result.execSummary:
All charges against Joshua J. Luther in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J. Luther is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

02:00 PM Defendant Joshua J. Luther in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds victim rights compliant.  Court has reviewed the briefs as submitted.  Court reviews facts of the case.  Court grants motion of defense to suppress the blood test for the reasons stated on the record.  Attorney Bolles to draft the order.  Attorney Klomberg heard on scheduling, will not be able to proceed to jury trial in May, request the trial be removed from the calendar.  Court grants and takes trial off calendar and schedules telephone scheduling conference.  Attorney Klomberg request transcript.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joshua J. Luther in court with attorney Lauren Stuckert and attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Bolles heard on Motion to Suppress Blood Results.  Attorney Klomberg calls Deputy Scott Ziorgen, S/T.  Record reflects witness identifies defendant.  Cross examination by Attorney Bolles.  Witness excused.  State rests.  Defense has no witnesses.  Court questions Attorney Klomberg on State v. Blackman and how this case difers from Blackman.  Attorney Bolles heard.  Discussion held.  Attorney Stuckert request a brief recess to discuss with client possibility of reopening.  Court grants recess.  Back on the record.  Attorney Stuckert request court reopen the record to allow defendant to testify.  Attorney Klomberg heard, objects to record being reopened.  Attorney Stuckert responds.  Attorney Klomberg responds.  Discussion continues.    Court heard;  Record is closed.  Parties to submit briefs.  Parties agree defense will file brief by noon on November 16, 2018;  state will file brief by close of business on December 21, 2018 and defense has until January 18, 2019 to file any response brief.  Discussion on trial date.  Attorney Stuckert advises there expert has an extremely busy calendar and may not be able to testify until end of year.    Court schedules trial for 5 days in May.  Counsel advise may not take 5 days.  Attorney Stuckert states there expert is available.  Court also schedules decision hearing.

(1:34) Defendant Joshua J. Luther in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles. Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is motions in limine filed by State, no others filed; Court notes that he has rec'd letter from Atty. Bolles requesting that this be adjourned, State objects to same; Court reviews motions in limine: #1 - no objection, but there is request for Miranda/Goodchild hearing, State wants motion filed on same; #2 - Atty. Bolles wants adequate notice; #3 - granted; #4 - granted; #5 - time schedule to be set; #6 - granted; # 7 - hearing outside jurors to discuss same; #8 - granted; #9 - granted; #10 - Atty. Bolles strongly objects, State argument - Court notes that matter needs to be briefed and this motion is held in abeyance, #11 - granted; #12 - discussion held, Court wants brief on this issue; discussion held on whether JT date will remain in July; State argument in opposition to continuance; recess taken (2:10); 2:27 reconviene - State heard on request for cont., but will not object to same; Def. to get expert on time; JT reset to 8/15/16, 8/16, 8/17 - dates will not work for State; JT reset for 10/3, 4 & 5 as #1 JT date - will NOT be adjourned; Motions in limine and briefing schedule discussed; State brief due 7/15/16, Atty. Bolles brief due 8/12/16, State has one week to respond 8/19/16; Motions in limine and decisions on that motion 9/14/16 at 8:15am, Miranda/Goodchild to be dealt with then; Def.'s witness list due 8/1/16, expert reports due 8/1/16; demonstrative exhibits due on date of motions in limine  Motion hearing scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Arraignment at 02-03-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Joshua J. Luther in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Dep. Scott Ziorgen, sworn & testifies; witness ID's defendant; discussion held; State rests; defense rests; Court heard and finds prob cause;  Arraignment scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JPZ m/w dob 11/20/70.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:00 - Defendant Joshua J. Luther in court with attorney David Andrew Bolles.  Intern Kevin Schmidt for ADA Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $10,000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JPZ m/w dob 11/20/70.   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
